snippet: The family narrative that has provided such inspirational fire and biographical heft to Mr. Cruz’s campaign is, his father’s former comrades and friends say, an embroidered one.
abstract: Republican presidential candidate Sen Ted Cruz and his father Rafael have told stories of Rafael fighting as rebel leader in Cuba in 1950s for Fidel Castro, but Rafael's contemporaries say family narrative is embroidered; former comrades and friends say he marched in streets but was not rebel leader engaging in violence.

byline.contributor: Hannah Berkeley Cohen contributed reporting from Havana. Kitty Bennett contributed research.

lead_paragraph: The family narrative that has provided such inspirational fire and biographical heft to Mr. Cruz’s campaign is, his father’s former comrades and friends say, an embroidered one.

headline.main: Cuban Peers Dispute Ted Cruz’s Father’s Story of Fighting for Castro
headline.print_headline: Elder Cruz’s Fight for Castro Is Questioned by Cuban Peers
